Module com.lmax.solana4j.client
Package com.lmax.solana4j.client.api

Interface SignatureForAddress

  • public interface SignatureForAddress
    Represents a transaction signature associated with a specific address on the Solana blockchain. This interface provides access to details such as errors, memos, signatures, slots, block times, and confirmation statuses.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Long getBlockTime()
      Retrieves the estimated production time of the block containing the transaction.
      Commitment getConfirmationStatus()
      Retrieves the confirmation status of the transaction.
      java.lang.Object getErr()
      Retrieves the error information associated with the transaction, if any.
      java.lang.String getMemo()
      Retrieves the memo associated with the transaction.
      java.lang.String getSignature()
      Retrieves the base58-encoded signature of the transaction.
      java.lang.Long getSlot()
      Retrieves the slot number in which the transaction was confirmed.

    • Method Detail

      • getErr

        java.lang.Object getErr()
        Retrieves the error information associated with the transaction, if any. If the transaction was successful, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        an object representing the error, or null if the transaction was successful

      • getMemo

        java.lang.String getMemo()
        Retrieves the memo associated with the transaction. If no memo is present, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        a string containing the memo, or null if no memo is present

      • getSignature

        java.lang.String getSignature()
        Retrieves the base58-encoded signature of the transaction.
        Returns:
        a string representing the transaction's signature

      • getSlot

        java.lang.Long getSlot()
        Retrieves the slot number in which the transaction was confirmed. The slot is a specific point in the Solana blockchain where the transaction was processed.
        Returns:
        the slot number where the transaction was confirmed

      • getBlockTime

        java.lang.Long getBlockTime()
        Retrieves the estimated production time of the block containing the transaction. The block time is represented as a Unix timestamp (seconds since the Unix epoch). If the block time is not available, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        the block time as a Unix timestamp, or null if not available

      • getConfirmationStatus

        Commitment getConfirmationStatus()
        Retrieves the confirmation status of the transaction. The confirmation status indicates the level of finality reached for the transaction, such as processed, confirmed, or finalized.
        Returns:
        the Commitment representing the confirmation status of the transaction
